description:
**Fix Overview**:

To mitigate the Windows OLE remote code execution vulnerability (CVE-2024-30077):

1. Download and apply the relevant update package from the official Microsoft Update Catalog based on your Windows version:
   - For Windows 10 Version 22H2 (x64): [KB5039211](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5039211)
   - For Windows 10 Version 21H2 (x64): [KB5039211](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5039211)
   - For Windows 11 Version 21H2 (x64): [KB5039213](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5039213)
   - For Windows 11 Version 22H2 (x64): [KB5039212](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5039212)
   - For Windows 10 (32-bit): [KB5039225](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5039225)

2. Restart your system after installation to ensure changes take effect.

**Details**:
- This update resolves a heap-based buffer overflow that could allow remote code execution.
- Ensure your system is running a supported version of Windows before applying updates.

**Preconditions**:
- Backup critical data before proceeding with the update installation.
